newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Guadalcanal supports Ross gold project.
newsitem.headline: Guadalcanal supports Ross gold project.

text.p: The Guadalcanal government said on Friday it supported development of Ross Mining NL's Gold Ridge mining project in the Solomon Islands province.
"The Gold Ridge project is the greatest step forward that this country has made since independence on July 7, 1978," Guadalcanal premier Siriako Usa said.
Usa said the mine, which proposes to produce about 100,000 ounces a year starting in March 1998, would provide funds, educational opportunities and jobs for local residents.
The mine is being developed by Australian Stock Exchange-listed Ross Mining but still faces legal challenges from some local residents.
Bertus de Graaf, managing director and chief executive of Ross Mining, said the Guadalcanal government's official support of the mine offered further confirmation that the project is on schedulE.
At least two local landowners are involved in a court case in the Solomon Islands against Ross Mining over land rights.
Ross Mining disputes a claim by one of the claimants, Willie Roni, that a further 90 other landowners are involved in the claim.
Ross Mining shares closed one cent higher at 90 cents each.
